Articles.Content: It's been a while since I have really touched KSP, or even been in the forums for that matter. I kinda want to get back into it again, but was deterred by the 1.2 release since some of my favourite mods weren't updated for a while. For instance, EVE, Mechanical Jeb, and Distant Object Enhancement. Yet I have noticed people were able to use those in the 1.2 version and I have no idea how they managed to do that. I found a way around that only for KER via some sort of master folder thingy of some sort. KSP is a beautiful game even in stock... but after I have played so long without those mods it feels kind of lack lustre.
MechJeb is updated to 1.2.2, you need version 2.6.0 or higher. I don't know about the others.

As @eloquentJane says Mechjeb is working fine in 1.2.2.
For EVE, have a look at SVE

i thought DOE. Was working in 1.22. 

Can anyone confirm?

2 hours ago, sardia said:

i thought DOE. Was working in 1.22. 

Can anyone confirm?

DOE is packaged as part of Stock Visual Enhancements (SVE), and it IS running fine with 1.2.2.

In my experience, anything labelled for 1.2 or 1.2.1 works fine in 1.2.2.  I'm using DOE, KER, MechJeb with no issues whatsoever.  I get an AVC warning during loading for 12 mods that are for 1.2.1 or lower - including all of Nertea's Near Future stuff, and SCANSat - but they still work just fine.

In some cases, like Kopernicus, the mod is version locked, but I think most of those have been version-updated to work now in 1.2.2.

Welcome back, grammar patroll! We is glad to had you back!

Fire
